altText: Chernobyl: The History of a Nuclear Catastrophe, book by Serhii Plokhii
title: Chernobyl: The History of a Nuclear Catastrophe
author: Serhii Plokhii
review: I’m not ashamed to admit that it took HBO’s brilliant TV adaptation of the Chernobyl disaster to pique my interest enough to go and find out more about it. As unsettling as the show was, it comes nowhere near to revealing the true horror of the systemic failure and blatant refusal to face reality that was exhibited by the Soviet Union following the disaster at the number 4 reactor.\n The author Serhii Plokhii, a Ukrainian-American, is uniquely placed to give an authentic and deeper insight to how the disaster affected soviet Ukraine and the surrounding areas.
